concept.title: What Does A Wi-Fi Router Do?
concept.shortdesc: When you're setting up a Wi-Fi router for the first time, it can be helpful to understand what routers actually do!

section.p: Wi-Fi routers are devices used to sustain and manage a wireless internet connection between multiple devices and a modem. Routers work like a traffic controller or an intermediary, managing "packets" of data and moving them between the modem and your devices in a way that's more secure than just directly connecting your modem to the internet.
